PageTitle: display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance peer verbose
FuncDef: The display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance peer verbose command displays BGP IPv6 VPN FlowSpec and BGP VPNv6 FlowSpec peer detailed information.
CLIs: display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> peer verbose
display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> peer { <ipv4Addr> | <ipv6Addr> } verbose

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 address.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display  bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance aa peer v
BGP current state: Established, Up for 00h20m23s
Configured: Active Hold Time: 180 sec   Keepalive Time:60 sec
Negotiated: Active Hold Time: 180 sec   Keepalive Time:60 sec
Peer supports bgp route refresh capability
Address family FLOWv6: advertised and received
No refresh received since peer has been configured
No refresh sent since peer has been configured
Minimum route advertisement interval is 30 seconds
Route refresh capability has been enabled
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After BGP FlowSpec is enabled and a BGP FlowSpec peer relationship is established, you can run the display bgp flow vpnv6 vpn-instance peer verbose command to query information about the BGP FlowSpec peer.
